thread.title: This widly incorrect guess on 'Wheel of Fortune' will leave you screaming
thread.title_full: This widly incorrect guess on 'Wheel of Fortune' will leave you screaming

author: Johnny Lieu
title: This widly incorrect guess on 'Wheel of Fortune' will leave you screaming
text:
This guy needs a beer, or at least a brief explainer of 20th century American plays.
A contestant on "America's #1 game show!" Wheel of Fortune blew what was quite possibly one of the easiest puzzles in game show history on Tuesday night.
All he had to do was guess the remaining letter in this title to win the round: "A STREETCAR NA_ED DESIRE."
SEE ALSO: Atari arcade classics return as IRL board games
You don't have to be freakin' Tennessee Williams to know the answer, and yet this contestant gave the letter "K." Yes, K !
AHHHHAHAHAHAHA THIS REALLY JUST HAPPENED! pic.twitter.com/qcD8ybCwyB
— actually, a dad (@weedsocialist) March 21, 2017
Aren't those moans from the crowd just painful? Naturally, Twitter was ablaze with people wondering just how? How could this happen?
MRW the guy on wheel of fortune guessed “A Streetcar Na_ed Desire” was “A Streetcar Naked Desire." pic.twitter.com/JKJrc7PL6G
— T. Becket Adams (@BecketAdams) March 22, 2017
This guy on wheel of fortune just guessed "A Streetcar Naked Desire" I'm so done pic.twitter.com/ZsYdc3BmAA
— Emily Weiss (@emily_weiss28) March 21, 2017
I’d like to go on Wheel of Fortune, but I’d be the idiot that misses the easiest puzzle and goes viral for the wrong reason.
— Joe 'Monk' Pardavila (@joepardavila) March 22, 2017
But maybe this contestant was referring to the "other" version of A Streetcar Named Desire . If that even exists.
To be fair, A Street Car Naked Desire is the porn adaptation of Street Car
Wheel of Fortune
— Harmon Dash (@dashingharmon) March 22, 2017
Chances someone in the porn industry is writing a "A Streetcar Naked Desire" movie? #wheeloffortune #mistakes @CollegeHumor
— Allan Neskie (@lochnesk) March 21, 2017
He definitely blew it. Unfortunately, he'll have to enter in the annals of Wheel of Fortune infamy, like this dude a few years back, who messed up the pronunciation of "Achilles."
Makes you never, ever want to be on a game show.
